Keywords: Cosmic , Guardians of the Galaxy , Soldier
Real Name: Peter Quill
Special Powers
RECRUITER: POWER: Choose a character with the Guardians of the Galaxy keyword in your KO area that hasn't been chosen for or generated by a Recruiter effect. If you do, generate a character with the Guardians of the Galaxy keyword from your Sideline that has a lower point value than the chosen character. This game, the generated character can't be replaced and your opponent scores them immediately instead of when it's KO'd.
I GOT PART OF A PLAN: At the beginning of your turn, choose two. Star-Lord can use the chosen effects until he chooses again:
*Energy Explosion
*Precision Strike
*Pulse Wave
*Star-Lord has "FREE: Knock back all adjacent opposing characters 2 squares."

Comments
November 2, 2022
Decoder
[QUOTE=Glen Quagmire;12219160]I like Recruiter a lot, though Guardians doesn't offer much in the way of many "clean-up hitters" to bring in. 30-pt Gamora Daughter of Thanos is an excellent call-in if the placement is just right for close combat, and the 40-pt T'Challa Star-lords are useful if you really need Pulse wave or Precision Strike. I don't like to go above 45 for recruiter sideline figures, so that's about it. Even setting Recruiter aside, this is a nice 30 pts[/QUOTE] Giggity giggity goo
October 28, 2022
Glen Quagmire
I like Recruiter a lot, though Guardians doesn't offer much in the way of many "clean-up hitters" to bring in. 30-pt Gamora Daughter of Thanos is an excellent call-in if the placement is just right for close combat, and the 40-pt T'Challa Star-lords are useful if you really need Pulse wave or Precision Strike. I don't like to go above 45 for recruiter sideline figures, so that's about it. Even setting Recruiter aside, this is a nice 30 pts
